                         Mor Armony, Associate Professor of IOMS, and OM doctoral student Tarek Abdallah discuss her research on healthcare operations.            Natalia Levina, Associate Professor of Information Systems, presents at the Future of Business Event series.            Peter Lakner, Associate Professor of Statistics and Operations Research, presents his research on impulse control.                IOMS Groups:  Information Systems • Operations Management • Statistics           – About the department          The Department of Information, Operations & Management Sciences (IOMS) is home to faculty whose research style is analytical or technology-based.    The IOMS faculty have a well known reputation for excellence in research and teaching. Their research focuses in areas such as big data, outsourcing and offshoring, online advertising, mining social media content and social networks, revenue management and pricing, stochastic processing systems, long memory time series, categorical data analysis, and strategic analysis of global warming.                            Quick Links       Our Faculty    MBA Course Descriptions    UG Course Descriptions    IOMS Seminars          Recent News       OM Professor Srikanth Jagabathula receives $500,000 in funding from the National Science Foundation CAREER Award to further his research in developing data-driven modeling and learning techniques.    IOMS course, Operations in NYC , is featured in the NY Post for innovations in teaching by IOMS professors Harry Chernoff , Kristen Sosulski , and Mor Armony .    IS Professor Anindya Ghose and former IOMS PhD Jason Chan 's recently published paper is featured in The Economist .    OM Professor Ilan Lobel was awarded the 2014 Revenue Management and Pricing Section Prize for his paper , "Optimal Dynamic Mechanism Design and the Virtual-Pivot Mechanism" at INFORMS.          Department Leadership   Alex Tuzhilin, Chair  Ed Melnick, Deputy Chair  Vasant Dhar, IS Group Head  René Caldentey, OM Group Head  Peter Lakner, Statistics Group Head          IOMS Specializations       Business Analytics (formerly Data, Models & Decisions)    Management of Technology and Operations Specialization    Digital Marketing    Financial Systems & Analytics    Supply Chain Management and Global Sourcing Specialization        Spring 2015 Course Highlight    Programming in Python: INFO-GB.2335.01   Professor Hardeep Johar  The class will focus on giving students a working knowledge of programming languages and software design methodologies. Students will learn how large and small scale computer applications work, and how to build working prototypes to illustrate and market their own ideas.        IOMS Faculty Highlight    IOMS welcomes two full-time faculty members this fall:       Hila Lifshitz-Assaf  Assistant Professor  (PhD, Harvard Business School)       Xi Chen  Assistant Professor  (PhD, Carnegie Mellon and Postdoc, University of California, Berkeley)                                                                                                             News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N. Surgical Technologist | Surgical Technology Program                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Surgical Technology Program                                                                                  Home   Admission/Application   Faculty   Course   Student Work Policy   Tuition   Location   Contact Us                                  Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                           Surgical Technologist                               The NYU Langone Medical Center Surgical Technology Program is designed to prepare qualified individuals to become Surgical Technologists.   A Surgical Technologist is an integral member of the surgical team who works closely with the surgeon, anesthesiologist and registered nurse, delivering direct patient care before, during and after surgery.   The certified technologist may seek employment in the operating room, as a private scrub for a surgeon,  in the delivery room, central service, cardiac catheterization and surgi-centers.   The Program   It is a one year program, divided into two six-month semesters, with classes starting in September and March.   During the first semester, classes are held M-F from 5:30pm-9:30pm with (2) Saturdays a month from 9am - 5pm.   The second semester each student is in the clinical area 4 days a week from 7am-3pm and in the classroom one day a week. Scheduled hours for the classroom time may vary. The first semester is devoted to classroom study in aseptic technique fundamentals of operating room technology.   The latter portion of this semester is spent introducing the student to common basic surgical procedures.   The second semester is spent in the operating room to develop practical expertise and students are evaluated on their performance.                                                                                  NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

ResNet       NYU Blackboard       FAQs & Tutorials       NYUHome Help       ITS Training & Workshops       IT Service Status                     NYU Information Hotline: 1-212-998-1220   This hotline is used to provide recorded information on the University's current status, and will be used to transmit any important news or alerts. You can also check the NYU Information Alert web page: http://www.nyu.edu/info.alert .    NYU Public Safety: 1-212-998-2222   NYU's Office of Public Safety provides emergency help and information on a 24-hour basis. Use this number to request assistance or report an emergency.    Parent Helpline: 1-212-998-4219   A source of information and assistance for parents of NYU students regarding almost any University-related question or problem. The staff of the NYU Office of Student Life will answer your questions, refer you to appropriate resources, and, if necessary, act as a problem-solving liaison with other University units.    University Switchboard   The University switchboard (open from 8:00 a.m.-7:00 p.m., Monday-Friday during the regular semester)  provides directory listings for the following University centers: Washington Square; Kriser Dental Center;  Institute of Fine Arts (IFA); SCPS Midtown Center.     From on-campus: Dial 0   From outside of the NYU phone system: Dial 1-212-998-1212      To reach an NYU Medical Center operator to obtain directory listings   for the following locations: NYU Medical Center; Sterling Forest, Purchase, NY; Bellevue; Veterans Hospital     Dial 9 + 1 + 212 + 263-7300       Contact information for ITS resources not listed on this page:   Type a keyword into the search box on the upper right side of this page, search our knowledgebase , or search the NYU Directory .    Contact information for University-wide resources not listed on this page:   Search the NYU Directory .     Page last reviewed: July 29, 2013
